_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response Policies

The BrucePac refrigeration system uses pure anhydrous ammonia (a commonly used refrigerant for industrial systems) as the refrigerant. Given the quantity handled, anhydrous ammonia is considered a hazardous substance by EPA. Many of the properties that make ammonia valuable as a refrigerant also requires that precautions and procedures be in place to protect team member and public health and safety during a chemical emergency. It is the policy of BrucePac to be in compliance with applicable federal and state rules and regulations.
Safety at BrucePac is inherent on the manner in which anhydrous ammonia is handled. While the design of the facility incorporates a multitude of safety devices, safe handling procedures combined with appropriate training of our personnel are key aspects to maintaining safety at our facility.
We have a written Process Safety Management (PSM) plan that complies with the federal Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA) PSM requirements in Title 29 of CFR 1910.119. The Emergency Action Plan includes pre-emergency planning and coordinating with outside parties. This enables those who deal with emergencies to have a course of action to effectively deal with unplanned events.

Facility Description and Substances Handled

BrucePac is a manufacturing facility that produces, stores, and distributes meat products. Production requires the use of a refrigeration system to preserve the integrity of the processed foods. This refrigeration process uses ammonia as a refrigerant. Access to the facility is restricted to authorized team members, management personnel, and contractors. 

General Accidental Release Prevention Program and Chemical-Specific Prevention Steps

BrucePac complies with EPA's Accidental Release Prevention Rule and applicable state codes and regulations. The design and construction of this facility is consistent with published standards, tests or recom

mended methods of trade, industry or government organizations.
BrucePac's written PSM plan incorporates policies and procedures to ensure safe operation and maintenance of this facility. Plan elements essential to safe operation of the refrigeration system include team member participation, process safety information, process hazard analysis, operating procedures, training, contractor safety, pre-startup safety review, mechanical integrity, management of change, hot-work permits, incident investigation, emergency planning, and compliance audits. This plan will be reviewed annually and updated as necessary by the BrucePac personnel.
Training is provided to ensure that each team member involved in operating a process has been trained in an overview of the process, the operating procedures, and safety considerations. Only qualified personnel operate and interact with the refrigeration system. This minimizes the chances of inadvertent error in operation that could lead to a release of ammonia. Startup, shutdown and any onstream adjustments are handled by these qualified persons. 

Five-year Accident History

There was a reportable accident in 2017 involving a valve leak that released approximately 50 pounds of anhydrous ammonia. Three employees were treated for minor throat irritation and released on the same day. There were no offsite impacts. There have been no other reportable accidents in the last five years.  

Emergency Planning and Response

BrucePac has a written Emergency Action Plan to ensure that precautions and procedures are in place to protect team member and public health and safety during a chemical emergency. It complies with the provisions of OSHA regulations, 29 CFR 1910.38. This Emergency Action Plan includes pre-emergency planning and coordinating with outside parties. This enables those who deal with emergencies to have a course of action to effectively deal with unplanned events. This plan has been reviewed with the Durant Fire Departmen

t. 
The approach in the development of this plan has been to identify the ammonia emergencies most likely to occur at BrucePac and establish precautions and procedures to protect life safety and health during an emergency. The refrigeration process has back-up prevention systems to keep processing malfunctions from becoming ammonia release emergencies. If an emergency does occur, the following response personnel, facilities, and equipment are in place:
 ¿Emergency Alarm and Communication System
 ¿Evacuation Plans and Assembly Points
 ¿Personal Protective Equipment
The role and procedures for obtaining external emergency assistance have been formally established with the Durant Fire Department. 
BrucePac personnel will be trained to fulfill their designated responsibilities in an emergency. This plan will be reviewed periodically and updated as necessary by BrucePac.

Planned Changes to Improve Safety

Any upgrades or extensive maintenance work performed in the future will be in compliance with those standards applicable at that time. 
BrucePac has completed a process hazard analysis to identify recommendations to reduce the risk of an accident. Higher priority items are scheduled to be completed before the end of 2021. Lower priority items will be addressed before the next scheduled analysis in 2026.
